page.title: 01Overton and Fyfield Downland
page.content: This is an area of two divisions: rolling downs and narrow lowland valley. There is still sheep farming on the{chalky downlands,}but some land has now been ploughed and cultivated. The downs are well_known for their abundance of wild flowers, and for their bird_life, particularly species nesting on the ground. Plover and orchid live freely together in the airy expanses. In the{Kennet Valley}nestle clusters of old cottages and some modern dwellings. Here the hedgerows and small woods are homes for wildlife and birds, bluebells and primroses. Here too, in the valley, the old Bath to London coaching road follows the twisting Kennet River.
